dcterms:creator: B. King-Casas
C. Sharp
L. Lomax
T. Lohrenz
P. Fonagy
dcterms:description: The multi-round trust task is a social exchange game involving two people, one playing the role of an 'investor' and the other as a 'trustee', over 10 sequential rounds. The investor can send an initial endowment to the trustee, which is then tripled by the experimenter, and the trustee decides how much to return to the investor.
dcterms:title: Multi-round Trust Task

dcterms:creator: T. Xiang
R. Debajyoti
T. Lohrenz
P.R. Montague
P. Dayan
dcterms:description: Data from the study investigates the computational phenotyping of two-person interactions, revealing differential neural responses to depth-of-thought in social exchanges.
dcterms:title: Data from Xiang et al. (2012)

dcterms:creator: B. King-Casas
D. Tomlin
C. Anen
C.F. Camerer
S.R. Quartz
dcterms:description: Data from the study explores reputation and trust in a two-person economic exchange, providing insights into the dynamics of social interactions.
dcterms:title: Data from King-Casas et al. (2005)

dcterms:creator: M. Koshelev
T. Lohrenz
M. Vannucci
P.R. Montague
dcterms:description: Data from the study presents a biosensor approach to psychopathology classification, contributing to the understanding of mental health disorders.
dcterms:title: Data from Koshelev et al. (2010)

dcterms:creator: P.H. Chiu
M.A. Kayali
K.T. Kishida
D. Tomlin
L.G. Klinger
dcterms:description: Data from the study investigates self-responses along the cingulate cortex, revealing a quantitative neural phenotype for high-functioning autism.
dcterms:title: Data from Chiu et al. (2008)

dcterms:creator: K. McCabe
D. Houser
L. Ryan
V. Smith
T. Trouard
dcterms:description: Data from the study presents a functional imaging study of cooperation in two-person reciprocal exchange, contributing to the understanding of social behavior.
dcterms:title: Data from McCabe et al. (2001)
